We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:

  • Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
  • Data Analyst - £50,000
  • Business Data Analyst - £67,500
  • Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
  • Business Analysts - £60,000

Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.

  • Microsoft excel - to expert level.
  • Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
  • Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
  • Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.

Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: ⭐ Data & Insights Analyst ⭐
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
📊 Data & Insights Analyst 📉







Salary: £45,000 - £50,000 + Annual Bonus + Benefits (Private Health, Free Gym Membership, up to 12% Pension Contribution)

Hours: 09:00hrs - 17:00hrs (with a true 9-5 culture)

Start: Immediate (willing to wait for notice period)

Contract: Permanent / Full-Time - (Hybrid) 2 day WFH

Location: London, Liverpool Street










🚀 Culture Guru is recruiting for a 📊 Data & Insights Analyst 📉 to be part of an ever-growing, data-capturing and data-identifying business that has been established for over 40 years, partnering with over 2 million companies.










💫 With a company ambition of informing and protecting people, this 📊 Data & Insights Analyst 📉 role will play a pivotal part in this company's future strategy plan. In summary, the 📊 Data & Insights Analyst 📉 will demonstrate that through insights this business can drive sustainable growth.










🤓 Responsibilities of the role but not limited to;







Collaborate with the Data Leader to spearhead the implementation of the dynamic data strategy, ensuring it’s always relevant and effectively communicated to all stakeholders.
Lead the PowerBI transformation, migrating all reports and dashboards to this powerful platform. You’ll identify key users, provide essential training, and foster a self-service reporting environment built on reliable data.
Craft and present compelling data visualizations that turn insights into action for the executive team, making complex information easy to understand and aligned with the brand identity.
Deliver timely, high-quality insights that drive recruitment and retention efforts, providing the data needed for impactful decision-making.
Maintain a single source of truth for the data, ensuring consistency and reliability that empowers the entire organization to engage confidently with the information.
Enhance the core data resources by making strategic recommendations based on reputable external sources. You’ll ensure the Insights SQL database is optimized and design transformations to meet evolving reporting needs.
Take the lead on a company-wide data quality initiative, advising senior leadership on best practices for improving data integrity and structure.
Educate teams on utilizing member data effectively to inform business strategies and decision-making processes.
Anticipate potential risks in data collection and reporting, implementing robust models to safeguard against inaccuracies.
Provide precise insights and statistics for reports and presentations, ensuring all information is clear and actionable.
Engage with cross-functional teams to regularly assess their insight needs, developing frameworks to capture requirements and document the processes behind data usage.
Explore new opportunities to elevate business insights by identifying additional data sources and enhancing analytical methods.
Build strong partnerships across departments, acting as a trusted advisor to support evidence-based decision-making aligned with the strategic goals.
Maintain and refine the data governance practices, ensuring that the catalogue of data assets is up-to-date and easily accessible.
Establish a central hub for analytical insights that allows stakeholders to easily access and utilize reports and analyses, empowering them to make data-driven decisions.










✍️ Ideal experience of the successful candidate










Be the data rockstar in your department, serving as the go-to expert for strategic guidance on data collection and reporting that drives impactful decisions.
Thrive as a collaborative team player, ready to support and uplift the entire organization with your insights and expertise.
Master the art of data interpretation, pulling insights from diverse sources to shape business decisions and fuel innovative, data-driven campaigns.
Showcase your expertise with cutting-edge data visualization tools, especially Power BI, transforming raw data into compelling visual narratives that captivate your audience.
Bring data to life for everyone—from tech novices to seasoned pros—using your excellent technical skills in Excel and PowerPoint to make complex information easily digestible.
Use your skills in data storytelling to present insights across all levels of the business, ensuring your findings resonate and inspire action.
Demonstrate your proficiency in database management with tools like SQL and Python, skillfully manipulating data to extract meaningful insights.
Manage relationships with suppliers and agencies, collaborating with third parties to enrich the data landscape and expand our knowledge base.
Hold a degree or higher in a relevant field, showcasing your commitment to the industry.
Bring at least five years of valuable business experience, ready to make a significant impact on the data initiatives!










😍 Desirable attributes of the successful candidate







Dive into the dynamic world of subscription and SaaS organizations, equipped with a keen understanding of the unique challenges they face.
Leverage your expertise in Google Analytics to uncover insights that drive strategic decisions and enhance user experiences.
Bring your CRM know-how, particularly with HubSpot or NetSuite, to optimize customer interactions and build lasting relationships.
Utilize your customer journey mapping skills to enhance experiences through a test-and-learn mindset, driving continuous improvement at every touchpoint.
Combine a business-savvy mindset with exceptional data analysis skills, turning numbers into actionable strategies that propel the organization forward.
Master the art of data storytelling, translating complex insights into engaging narratives that resonate with stakeholders at all levels.
Cultivate a curious spirit, connecting teams to the powerful messages hidden within data, and inspiring action through your insights.
Think conceptually and pay meticulous attention to detail, ensuring that no insight goes unnoticed.
Exhibit astute listening and observational skills that help you understand the needs and perspectives of others, fostering collaboration.
Communicate with exceptional verbal and written skills, conveying ideas clearly and compellingly.
Embrace a flexible work style with a proactive approach, effortlessly juggling multiple tasks and initiatives.
Network across functions with ease, influencing and building relationships that elevate your impact throughout the organization.
Be an enthusiastic and motivated collaborator, taking pride in your accountability and commitment to team success.
Showcase excellent time management and organizational skills, ensuring that deadlines are met without sacrificing quality.
Engage effectively with stakeholders, demonstrating high-level management capabilities that build trust and foster collaboration.
Thrive in ambiguous situations, confidently navigating uncertainty and finding clarity in complex scenarios.







✅ Why this company? Check out their benefits...







Private Health
Free Gym Membership
Up to 12% Pension Contribution
9-5 Working Culture
Free Breakfast / Fruit
Hybrid Working (2 days WFH)
2 x Volunteer Days
2 x Paid leave days to move home
Competitive annual travel insurance scheme
Interest-free season ticket loan
Buy or sell up to 5 days of holiday at the end of each holiday year










Apply with your CV today to avoid missing this opportunity.

Show more

All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:

  • Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
  • Data Analyst - £50,000
  • Business Data Analyst - £67,500
  • Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
  • Business Analysts - £60,000

Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.

  • Microsoft excel - to expert level.
  • Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
  • Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
  • Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.

Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Graduate Data Analyst - Early Career Opportunity - Investment Management - Central London / Hybrid - £35k-£40k + bonus and benefits




We have an incredible opportunity for a Graduate Data Analyst, with a STEM based degree and 6months+ experience in data analysis and coding, to join a fantastic investment organisation based in stunning offices in Central London as their Data Analyst




Joining a dynamic Investor Relations team, the Data Analyst will be responsible for assisting with data-related projects, ensuring the quality of the data is of the highest standards and fixing any issues that may arise, with support from external parties.




As you will be the main point of contact for issues and questions and the main provider of high-quality data exports, we’re looking for someone with strong knowledge and some working experience of data sets and coding (SQL is advantageous).







What’s on offer?

This is a genuinely incredible graduate / entry-level opportunity to get your foot in the door of a dynamic, fast-paced investment firm with fantastic long-term prospects!

Our client is offering a competitive salary and a great benefits package that includes a discretionary bonus.







Key responsibilities as the Data Analyst will include:




Being main point of contact for issues and queries relating to data integration
Undertaking high-quality data exports
Assisting teams with importing data and data related administration
Undertaking the role of Systems Administrator for portals
Support with projects to help improve processes and increase automation

And more







What we’re looking for:




Recent graduate (or similar) in a STEM related degree
Data management qualification is highly beneficial
3-6 months+ work experience or internship as a Data Analyst (or similar)
Exposure, knowledge and understanding of working with large data sets
Experience of dealing with complex and sensitive client data (highly beneficial)
Strong knowledge, understanding and proficiency in coding (SQL)
Good data manipulation / data control skills
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
Confident communication skills (written and spoken) with the ability to liaise confidently and professionally at all levels
Strong IT literacy including MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
Professional attitude and appearance
Proactive and flexible team player




Interested in this incredible Graduate Data Analyst opportunity?

If this fantastic role is of interest and you have the skills, experience and knowledge we’re looking for, then we want to hear from you ASAP! Please submit your CV, quoting ‘AE - Graduate Data Analyst - London’

Show more

HTML:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:

  • Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
  • Data Analyst - £50,000
  • Business Data Analyst - £67,500
  • Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
  • Business Analysts - £60,000

Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.

  • Microsoft excel - to expert level.
  • Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
  • Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
  • Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.

Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Finance and Data Analyst
Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW




Embark on a captivating journey with Designer Parfums, a leading name in the luxury fragrance industry, with a diverse portfolio that boasts global brands like CERRUTI, PLAYBOY, GHOST, ARIANA GRANDE, JENNIFER LOPEZ, GANT, MCM, HAWAIIN TROPIC, and more. As an organization, we are fueled by creativity, innovation, and international aspirations. Here, your work transcends conventional boundaries. Join us to redefine the fragrance landscape.







JOB OVERVIEW




As the Global Brands Finance and Data Analytics Analyst, you are not just a number-cruncher; you are a strategic thinker and catalyst for commercial excellence. Your work will involve pioneering insightful commercial reporting and delivering data-driven recommendations that shape the future of our diverse fragrance portfolio. Reporting directly to the Managing Director, your analytical expertise will be pivotal in driving both financial and operational improvements across multiple brands and markets.




KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES




Partner with cross-functional teams to decode revenue and profitability drivers, thereby influencing business and brand strategy.
Master the intricacies of Profit & Loss statements to offer nuanced insights into income drivers and potential growth areas.
Champion data-driven decision-making and brand strategy by creating robust forecasting models that anticipate market trends.
Leverage external data sources to evaluate market performance, identifying opportunities and challenges.
Steer investment decisions by providing invaluable financial modelling and analysis, challenging assumptions where necessary.
Conduct meticulous SKU-level profit analysis to inform brand and market strategies.
Evaluate ROI on media and in-store investments, supporting the Managing Director in establishing uniform KPIs across brands.
License Reporting. Monitor and provide analytics support for License contract compliance, specifically focusing on royalty arrangements.
Contribute proactively to multi-disciplinary task forces aimed at boosting efficiency and business acumen.







QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:




A Levels or Bachelor’s degree in Maths and/or Finance/Business/Economics
A minimum of 1+ years in commercial analytics, financial reporting, or a similar role within the finance or data analytics department
Expert in Excel and proficient in Microsoft Office Suite; SAP knowledge is a plus. Excel knowledge fluency and speed will be an important requirement for a candidate comfortable with all Excel keyboard power functions and data analytics functions
Knowledge of Profit and Loss Statement is a plus







DESIRED TRAITS




Excel whizz
Strong numerical skills and mental maths acumen to be able to identify errors/inconsistencies in data or analysis quickly
Commercial and strategic mindset
Exceptional analytical rigor
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Commitment to detail and quality
Proactive, collaborative, and a strong advocate for positive change
Quick learner with the ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment




WHY CHOOSE DESIGNER PARFUMS?




If you're a dynamic individual who thrives on innovation and cherishes the opportunity to learn and be a change-maker in an ever-evolving industry, Designer Parfums offers you the perfect platform to showcase your talent and passion. Become a key part of our journey to captivate senses and hearts worldwide.




Global Impact: Shape global brand strategies for iconic fragrances and beauty products, making an enduring mark.

Analytical Excellence: Leverage analytical skills to uncover market trends and drive data-driven decisions.

Cultural Exchange: Collaborate with international markets

Innovation Hub: Thrive in a fast-paced environment that thrives on innovation and creativity.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst / SQL / Power BI / London / Permanent / Onsite / £35,000 - £40,000pa




Overview

Vivo Talent is excited to share that we’re working with one of the largest global leaders in music event management, who are seeking a highly skilled Analyst to join their growing Data team.




As part of a fast-paced, private equity-backed platform, you will work closely with the Head of Data and senior stakeholders to drive data-driven decision-making across a diverse portfolio of festivals. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape the commercial finance strategy of a leading player in the music festival industry, gaining exposure to a range of high-profile events across the world.




Great opportunity for a Data Analyst or BI Analyst to grow in their role and be mentored and coached by the Head of Data themselves.




Responsibilities

Overseeing structuring, mapping and managing of ticketing data for account executives using Microsoft Excel and Power BI
Designing, developing, and deploying business analytics reports and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI data sets
Work with the Data and BI Manager to accelerate and facilitate the Finance team’s use of Power BI
Gain expertise in existing Power BI datasets and contribute to design of new datasets
Gain expertise in Azure automation to provide support for daily refresh
Analysing data trends between ticket sales and marketing initiatives to help boost company sales




Experience & Skills

Proven track record with at least 2 years experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, or BI Analyst
Power BI knowledge, including Power Query, DAX measures and expressions, creating data-rich reports and performing ad-hoc analysis
Experience using Microsoft SQL Server and use / development of SSIS packages in Visual Studio
Excellent communicator with strong oral, written and presentation skills combined with the ability to explain complex solutions to a range of audiences




If you’re interested in learning more about this opportunity, then please get in touch or send an application through!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job id: 095074

Salary: £37,332 - £42,099 including London Weighting Allowance.

Business unit: King's Digital

Department: King's Digital.

Location: Strand Campus

Category: Professional & Support Services.




About us

Our mission is to provide transformative, high-quality digital education, so students can learn, wherever they are.




We collaborate with academics and professional services staff across the university, and with our external partners, to design, develop and deliver a wide range of educational programmes.




Our learners study with us from across the world, choosing when and where they study, working around their schedules.




We are a dynamic team with ambitious growth targets in a priority area of development for King’s. We proudly foster a supportive culture and community which prioritises both individual and collective wellbeing.




Employee support at King’s includes flexible working arrangements, paid maternity/shared parental leave, menopausal support, an active wellbeing programme, training and development opportunities and much more. All of our staff benefit from a generous pension contribution as well.




As part of hybrid working at King’s, all team members can work remotely for part of the week if they wish.




Join us as we open futures and unlock potential.




About the role

In this exciting new role within King's Digital, the Data Analyst will be supporting in driving the data strategy and operations of the University’s online programmes. Reporting to the Data Governance and Lead Analyst, the Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in producing regular and ad-hoc reports that deliver insights into management information, business intelligence, and statistical analysis. These reports will support key stakeholders across various teams and departments within the University.




The Data Analyst will develop a comprehensive understanding of the data that underpins King’s Digital and its programmes, using tools like Power BI to enhance productivity and inform decision-making. This role involves data manipulation and interpretation to support student experience and online delivery optimisation and in refining and improving student data processes.




Additionally, the Data Analyst will ensure that reporting is seamlessly integrated with university processes, maintaining strong communication and coordination with central data reporting teams, data governance teams, academic faculties, admissions, and marketing. As the primary point of contact for data-related inquiries, the postholder will manage reporting outputs, uphold data security, and ensure compliance with data protection regulations. The role also involves providing training and guidance to report users, promoting self-service capabilities, and enhancing the data literacy of King's Digital staff. Through these efforts, the Data Analyst will contribute significantly to the overall King’s Digital Data Strategy.




This is a full-time post and you will be offered an indefinite contract.




Contact details: Wyman Jayarajah. wyman.jayarajah@kcl.ac.uk




Closing date: 25 September 2024.




To apply, please click “Apply Now”.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst – Technology Transformation

Location: London - Hybrid/Flexible Work Options

Contract Type: Fixed Term (12 months)

Salary: Competitive, depending on experience




About Us

Our client is embarking on an exciting end-to-end technology transformation retiring from one system and moving onto another.

To support this ambitious program of work, we are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic transformation team on a fixed-term contract basis.




Key Responsibilities

As the Data Analyst, you will play a key role in analysing and interpreting complex data sets to support strategic business decisions during the transformation. Your primary responsibilities will include:

Data Collection & Management: Gather, cleanse, and manage large datasets from various sources to support project objectives.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Conduct in-depth analyses to provide insights that guide decision-making during the technology transformation.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with key stakeholders, including IT, project managers, and business leaders, to understand data requirements and deliver insights.
Performance Tracking: Develop and maintain dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and the overall impact of the transformation.
Data Visualisation: Present complex data in an accessible, visually compelling manner to non-technical stakeholders.




Skills & Experience

We are looking for a motivated, detail-oriented Data Analyst with a proven track record of delivering data-driven insights from end to end. To succeed in this role you will need:

Experience: Minimum 3-5 years in a data analysis role, preferably with experience supporting technology transformation or large-scale projects end to end
Technical Skills:
Experience of SQL, Scripting, Data Mining Techniques to carry out data extraction from source of core legacy system
Experience with ETL within a iPaaS environment is essential
Knowledge of Semarchy, Informatica and Salesforce Desirable
Analytical Mindset: Strong problem-solving abilities and a keen eye for detail to interpret and present data effectively.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Data: Proven hands-on experience of carrying out data audits, data cleansing on transformation projects in preparation for migration




If this sounds like you, please apply!

Title: Data Analyst - Risk
Description:
We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our clients Risk Models and Data team within the 2nd Line of Defence (2LOD). This is an exciting opportunity to support key data analysis and governance initiatives while contributing to the wider risk management function.




Key Responsibilities:

Run regular production of Management Information (MI) reports and handle ad-hoc data analysis requests.
Assist in the development of both ad-hoc and regular management reporting through robust data analysis.
Enhance the efficiency of MI production processes.
Support data quality resolution and data lineage activities within the team.
Contribute to building a strong data governance and data quality framework within the risk function.
Ensure compliance with the bank's Risk Management framework and escalate concerns when necessary.




What We’re Looking For:

Minimum 1 year of experience working with data analysis in financial services.
Degree educated (or equivalent), preferably in a STEM subject.
Intermediate knowledge of SAS and SQL, with a passion for further development.
Understanding of risk/financial terminology with a desire to expand this knowledge.
Proficient in MS Excel, including formulas and pivot tables; knowledge of Power BI is a plus.
Strong attention to detail and a proactive, collaborative approach.




**unfortunately, no sponsorship is available for this position**

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Camino Search are delighted to be partnered with a hyper growth PE backed technology business that are scaling. The business has a solid market foundation, has international presence and has been through multiple rounds of funding. They boast an innovative, market-leading product with multiple revenue streams. They now require advanced CRM analytics to develop and drive strategic initiatives as they continue to grow towards a potential exit.




Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and process large datasets from multiple sources.
Analyze data trends and patterns to provide actionable insights.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports for key performance indicators.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide support for data-driven decision-making.
Conduct A/B testing and generate reports on performance metrics.
Monitor data integrity and ensure accurate reporting across various platforms.
Assist in the development and optimization of data collection systems and analytical processes.




Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Strong knowledge of statistical analysis and modeling techniques.
Experience with SQL and database management.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to communicate complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Title: Junior Insight Analyst - Contract
Description:
Junior Insight Executive

6-Month Fixed Term Contract | £30,000 Salary | Hybrid Working (London)




Salt is working with one of the UK's leading social media agencies, renowned for creating impactful, data-driven campaigns for some of the biggest brands in the world. We're seeking a passionate and driven Junior Insight Executive to join on an initial 6-month fixed-term contract, with the opportunity to transition into a permanent role.




As a Junior Insight Executive, you will be at the heart of our data and insights team, transforming social listening data into powerful stories that drive real impact for clients. Your passion for turning complex data into clear, actionable recommendations will be key in helping clients make informed decisions and shape their digital strategies.




Key Responsibilities:

Social Listening & Analysis: Use social listening tools to monitor conversations, trends, and sentiment around key topics and brands.
Data Storytelling: Transform data insights into compelling, easy-to-understand stories that inform and engage stakeholders.
Reporting & Insights: Create reports that provide actionable recommendations based on your analysis, contributing to campaign success and strategy refinement.
Collaboration: Work closely with the wider insights and account teams to ensure data-driven insights align with overall campaign objectives.
Trend Spotting: Stay ahead of digital trends and identify opportunities for our clients to stay at the forefront of their industries.




About you:

A natural problem-solver with a strong ability to interpret and analyse data
A deep interest in social media platforms and digital trends, and how they can influence brand strategy.
Ability to translate data into clear, insightful stories that inspire action
Ideally experience or familiarity with social listening tools (e.g., Brandwatch, Sprout Social, Talkwalker)
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with an eye for detail and clarity.

Your passion for turning complex data into clear, actionable recommendations will be key in helping clients make informed decisions and shape their digital strategies.




Key Responsibilities:

Social Listening & Analysis: Use social listening tools to monitor conversations, trends, and sentiment around key topics and brands.
Data Storytelling: Transform data insights into compelling, easy-to-understand stories that inform and engage stakeholders.
Reporting & Insights: Create reports that provide actionable recommendations based on your analysis, contributing to campaign success and strategy refinement.
Collaboration: Work closely with the wider insights and account teams to ensure data-driven insights align with overall campaign objectives.
Trend Spotting: Stay ahead of digital trends and identify opportunities for our clients to stay at the forefront of their industries.




About you:

A natural problem-solver with a strong ability to interpret and analyse data
A deep interest in social media platforms and digital trends, and how they can influence brand strategy.
Ability to translate data into clear, insightful stories that inspire action
Ideally experience or familiarity with social listening tools (e.g., Brandwatch, Sprout Social, Talkwalker)
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with an eye for detail and clarity.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Graduate Data Analyst - Early Career Opportunity - Investment Management - Central London / Hybrid - £35k-£40k + bonus and benefits




We have an incredible opportunity for a Graduate Data Analyst, with a STEM based degree and 6months+ experience in data analysis and coding, to join a fantastic investment organisation based in stunning offices in Central London as their Data Analyst




Joining a dynamic Investor Relations team, the Data Analyst will be responsible for assisting with data-related projects, ensuring the quality of the data is of the highest standards and fixing any issues that may arise, with support from external parties.




As you will be the main point of contact for issues and questions and the main provider of high-quality data exports, we’re looking for someone with strong knowledge and some working experience of data sets and coding (SQL is advantageous).







What’s on offer?

This is a genuinely incredible graduate / entry-level opportunity to get your foot in the door of a dynamic, fast-paced investment firm with fantastic long-term prospects!

Our client is offering a competitive salary and a great benefits package that includes a discretionary bonus.







Key responsibilities as the Data Analyst will include:




Being main point of contact for issues and queries relating to data integration
Undertaking high-quality data exports
Assisting teams with importing data and data related administration
Undertaking the role of Systems Administrator for portals
Support with projects to help improve processes and increase automation

And more







What we’re looking for:




Recent graduate (or similar) in a STEM related degree
Data management qualification is highly beneficial
3-6 months+ work experience or internship as a Data Analyst (or similar)
Exposure, knowledge and understanding of working with large data sets
Experience of dealing with complex and sensitive client data (highly beneficial)
Strong knowledge, understanding and proficiency in coding (SQL)
Good data manipulation / data control skills
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
Confident communication skills (written and spoken) with the ability to liaise confidently and professionally at all levels
Strong IT literacy including MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
Professional attitude and appearance
Proactive and flexible team player




Interested in this incredible Graduate Data Analyst opportunity?

If this fantastic role is of interest and you have the skills, experience and knowledge we’re looking for, then we want to hear from you ASAP! Please submit your CV, quoting ‘AE - Graduate Data Analyst - London’

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LiveRamp is the data collaboration platform of choice for the world’s most innovative companies. A groundbreaking leader in consumer privacy, data ethics, and foundational identity, LiveRamp is setting the new standard for building a connected customer view with unmatched clarity and context while protecting precious brand and consumer trust. LiveRamp offers complete flexibility to collaborate wherever data lives to support the widest range of data collaboration use cases—within organizations, between brands, and across its premier global network of top-quality partners.

Hundreds of global innovators, from iconic consumer brands and tech giants to banks, retailers, and healthcare leaders turn to LiveRamp to build enduring brand and business value by deepening customer engagement and loyalty, activating new partnerships, and maximizing the value of their first-party data while staying on the forefront of rapidly evolving compliance and privacy requirements.

About This Job

Do you love working with smart people who inspire you to be better and work harder every day? Do you want to join a high growth business and work with some of the world's biggest data sets? Do you want the freedom and responsibility necessary to propose, design and build new products? Consider joining us. This role will be based out of our rapidly growing London office.

Role Overview

Being a part of the UK Data Science Consulting Team, you will work to deliver our data science solutions to a wide range of external clients; from well-known retailers to some of the largest digital platforms in the world.

You will sit alongside our Data Science development team, to deliver our measurement solutions to some of the most well known social platforms and largest UK retailers

Responsibilities


Delivering our offline sales measurement product for some of the world’s largest social platforms and retailers
Work with our social platforms with recommendations to improve future campaigns
Make suggestions to improve current workflows and products


YOU WILL HAVE


Previous commercial or research experience as a data analyst
Hands-on experience in Python and SQL
Thorough understanding of Statistics
Client facing or stakeholder management experience delivering and presenting analytical results
The ability to communicate complex analytical information clearly to non-analytical audiences
Bachelor’s Degree in a numerate discipline (e.g. Maths, Science, Computing)
Interest in digital marketing


BONUS POINTS FOR


Experience with Cloud Compute technologies
Experience of advertising effectiveness measurement
Knowledge of digital marketing


More About Us

LiveRamp’s mission is to connect data in ways that matter, and doing so starts with our people. We know that inspired teams enlist people from a blend of backgrounds and experiences. And we know that individuals do their best when they not only bring their full selves to work but feel like they truly belong. Connecting LiveRampers to new ideas and one another is one of our guiding principles—one that informs how we hire, train, and grow our global team across nine countries and four continents. Click here to learn more about Diversity, Inclusion, & Belonging (DIB) at LiveRamp.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Alteryx + 10% bonus
Description:
#Salary on this role is tax free#




Overview

Our client is an established, international bank that is involved in progressive policy reform and investment, across multiple continents. They have over 4000 employees globally and are now looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join their team on a 3-year FTC basis, providing support internally on Alteryx and solution design for businesses.




Main Responsibilities

◾ Provide support in the use and development of solutions using Alteryx and Tableau internally.

◾ Advocate a consistent analysis, design, development and delivery of data solutions using recognized processes and techniques.

◾ Educate end-users in data solutions by proactively engaging with product owners, internal and external stakeholders.

◾ Create documents and workshops to educate users on data solutions.

◾ Document requests, test plans and solution designs.




Skills and Experience

◾ Extensive experience of development in Alteryx and Tableau.

◾ Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role

◾ Experience in the creation of dataflows, extracts, views, workbooks, deployments, schedules.

◾ Working knowledge of SQL (Oracle/SQL Server), data modelling concepts and standards.

◾ Familiarity with ETL processes and data warehousing principles.

◾ Strong team player with ability to work in a cross-functional team, following Agile principles.

◾ Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

◾ Experience in organising workshops and trainings is desirable.

Show more

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.

  • Microsoft excel - to expert level.
  • Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
  • Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
  • Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.

Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Analyst - Performance & Insights
Description:
At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.

Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.

Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.

About The Opportunity

eBay Motors is a multi-billion dollar, global portfolio comprising the Parts & Accessories, Business & Industrial, Vehicles, and WHI (a B2B Parts & Accessories marketplace in US) businesses. These categories are not only among the largest on eBay and core to eBay’s strategic future, but also are actively innovating in the market and at eBay!

We are looking to hire an expert analyst, who will support the eBay UK’s Parts & Accessories leadership team and play an instrumental role in accelerating growth for P&A’s UK business. The role will utilise data and business case development to develop strategic insights, while ensuring operational excellence in planning, analytics, reporting, and teamwork across a broad cross-functional team. Our key partners include product, marketing, analytics, finance, operations, monetization, and business development, among many others.

The role demands a dual mentality: both that of a strategic leader—who has a deep understanding of the dynamics of two-sided marketplaces, can break down tough problems into clear frameworks, operate in ambiguity, and possesses strong data intuition—as well as someone who can move quickly and decisively as an embedded operator not afraid to get their hands dirty.

What you will accomplish


Serve as an analytics partner to the UK Parts & Accessories leadership team
Apply strategic, operational, and analytical standard methodologies to extract and present actionable insights on what’s driving business performance
Build and develop key performance indicators and dashboards to track business performance. Responsible for monitoring metrics, identifying and understanding root causes behind the metrics movement, and synthesizing insights to communicate these insights to senior colleagues
Identify and execute against opportunities across the Parts & Accessories landscape that require strategic deep dives
Partner with Category Managers, partners, and sellers to drive key initiatives



What You Will Bring


Strategic problem solver with strong analytical/data science skills to dive into data and identity root causes
High degree of ownership and commitment to results
Self-motivated to find opportunities and challenges in the business
Communicates clearly, effectively, and proactively with strong listening, written, and verbal communication skills
Ambition to grow professionally and willingness to work hard, learn/adapt, and provide feedback both upward and to peer teams



Requirements


2+ years of related experience, ideally at a top-tier management consulting firm, investment bank, or in a strategy & planning role at a major corporation
Excellent analytical skills including familiarity with SQL
Interest and/or experience in Motors a plus, but not required
Knowledge of ecommerce and market landscape



Please see the Talent Privacy Notice for information regarding how eBay handles your personal data collected when you use the eBay Careers website or apply for a job with eBay.

eBay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for accommodation as soon as possible. View our accessibility statement to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities.

Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes: HI, NM)" excludes residents of Hawaii and New Mexico.

This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies. Visit our Privacy Center for more information.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.
