Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview:

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst with additional responsibilities in data

integration and product data syndication to join our team. This role will combine data analysis,

business intelligence development, and data flow management to support our business

initiatives and enhance decision-making processes.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis and Business Intelligence

1. Plan, design, develop, and document SQL views to support various business needs.

2. Create, maintain, and optimize PowerBI dashboards for multiple stakeholders.

3. Provide insights and analysis through data visualization to support business decision-

making.

4. Collaborate with business users to gather requirements and ensure dashboards meet

their needs.




Product Data Syndication

1. Ensure accurate and timely syndication of product data to various partners.

2. Monitor and report on data syndication performance and resolve any issues.

3. Collaborate with internal teams to gather and prepare product data for syndication.




Data Flow Management

1. Oversee the end-to-end process of data flow from source systems to central databases.

2. Implement and maintain ETL processes to ensure data integrity and consistency.

3. Conduct regular audits and data quality checks to ensure accuracy and completeness.

4. Work closely with other departments to address data-related issues and optimize data

flow processes.




Qualifications:

1. 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment.

2. Proven experience in data analysis, SQL, and business intelligence tools like PowerBI.

3. Able to understand and connect applications to data sources (integrations and APIs).

4. Experience with or willingness to learn about product data syndication.

5. Understanding of ETL processes and data flow management.

6. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

7. Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

8. Attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy and integrity.

9. Nice to have: Experience with manufacturing or distribution environments.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business / Data Analyst

Location: Mississauga, ON (Hybrid)

Duration: 12 Months




Responsibilities:

Exceptional proficiency in Excel and data analysis, particularly in using pivots and analyzing unfamiliar data to derive key observations.
Ability to create PowerPoint presentations that clearly articulate problem statements, supporting metrics, and proposed solutions.
Develop a comprehensive understanding of the Consent Order plan, including milestone linkages and interdependencies, and establish a robust data analytics function to identify and correct irregularities.
Implement checks, balances, and controls to systematically identify plan outliers.
Lead the development of analyses, presentations, and meeting materials to prompt stakeholder action, including presentations for regulators and senior internal clients.
Establish processes for storing data used in analytics to support future audits and regulatory queries.
Create charts and graphs to visually represent data findings in an executive-friendly manner.
Assess risks in business decisions, ensuring compliance with laws, rules, regulations, and policies while safeguarding reputation.




Skills:

Proficiency in working with large data sets to identify issues and develop correction plans.
Ability to interpret data meaningfully and draw out insights for senior stakeholders.
Understanding of risk-reward and the ability to provide diplomatic challenges to stakeholders, escalating issues when necessary.
Desirable skills include process mapping, consulting, and audit.




Dexian is a leading provider of staffing, IT, and workforce solutions with over 12,000 employees and 70 locations worldwide. As one of the largest IT staffing companies and the 2nd largest minority-owned staffing company in the U.S., Dexian was formed in 2023 through the merger of DISYS and Signature Consultants. Combining the best elements of its core companies, Dexian's platform connects talent, technology, and organizations to produce game-changing results that help everyone achieve their ambitions and goals.

Dexian's brands include Dexian DISYS, Dexian Signature Consultants, Dexian Government Solutions, Dexian Talent Development and Dexian IT Solutions. Visit https://dexian.com/ to learn more.

Dexian is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

Dexian | Unlock trajectory changing opportunities.

Unlock business potential with Dexian's comprehensive solutions. Discover staffing, talent development, and valuable resources. Explore now!

Title: Data Analyst - GCP
Description:
About TCS:




Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 615,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 55 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $27.9 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2023, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Skills and Responsibilities:

•Hands on and at good years work experience working with Google Cloud Services like Big Query, Dataflow, Data Proc, Cloud Functions, Cloud Data Fusion, Cloud Composer etc.

•Responsible & accountable for doing requirement gathering and creation of high level and detailed technical design

•Developing data ingestion framework for different sources

•Strong migration experience of Hadoop cluster to Google Cloud

•Ability to suggest optimal architectural solution on GCP to customer

•Strong knowledge in SQL, Java\Python

•Certified as Professional Data Engineer - GCP.

•Good Communication skill.

•Exposure to Hadoop ecosystem

•Prior working experience as Data Analyst or similar project.

•GCP knowledge and tools like Tableau / BI / Looker will be addition to this Role.

•Managing Data Analyst role, Compare data and match against the requirement.

•Analyzing various source of data and compare with target data.

•Responsible & accountable for doing requirement gathering and creation of high level and detailed technical design.




Tata Consultancy Services Canada Inc. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resource.

Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualification for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LeverageTek is actively seeking a Data Specialist for a 3-month contract with its Ottawa-based customer.




Work Location

Remote




Key Tasks

Liaise with internal Technology project teams and stakeholders to enable and ensure adherence to data standards, data quality, data planning, data governance, data security
Provide leadership to project teams and stakeholders to ensure an understanding of the organization's data policies, data quality standards, data governance, data processes
With project teams and stakeholders, identify project data needs, data risks
Conduct data profiling and assessment based on data quality rules
Conduct analysis of data to ensure compliance with standards and governance
Conduct data profiling, identify and develop metadata and data models
Provide knowledge transfer to project teams and stakeholders regarding best practices and adherence to the organizations’ data governance and quality standards
Provide ongoing reporting to the organization’s Data and Information Management team regarding project data status, attending regular meetings as required




Key Qualifications

6+ years experience specializing in data planning, data analysis, data quality, data governance, data security, data risk management
Strong expertise in Data Management and Data Governance
Experience in data profiling, data modeling, metadata, data processes




Key Qualifications

Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering or in a related field
Experience providing hands-on knowledge transfer to project teams
Strong team collaboration and leadership skills
Excellent communication skills (writing/verbal)
Experience writing and presenting reports to key stakeholders
Passion, diligence, analytical, detail-oriented
Experience with Agile principles and the Scrum Framework




Assets

Experience with the use of data modeling tools (Erwin, Collibra or other)
Experience with Data Quality tools




About LeverageTek IT Solutions

Thank you for taking the time to apply! Since our company’s inception in March 2003, LeverageTek IT Solutions has worked resolutely to become one of the industry’s most recognized and trusted suppliers of technology staffing and business consulting services. With hundreds of successful engagements to our credit with many of Canada’s leading public and private sector organizations, we are the experts in identifying, deploying, and supporting IT and business talent on a contract, contract-to-hire, and permanent basis. We work with customers across all sectors including academia, aerospace, aviation, finance, government, health care, high tech, military, not-for-profit, and more.

Our responsive service and ability to deliver the right fit, on time and within budget, typically leads to repeat engagements and a long-standing relationship.

Accessibility accommodations are available upon request.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Capco - L'avenir. Aujourd'hui.




Capco est un lieu de travail nettement et positivement différent. Bien plus que des consultants, nous sommes des participants actifs au sein de l'industrie mondiale des services financiers. Nos professionnels passionnés des affaires et de la technologie bénéficient d'un environnement unique où ils sont activement encouragés à mettre en œuvre l'intelligence, l'innovation, l'expérience et le travail d'équipe. Nous nous engageons à soutenir pleinement nos clients de classe mondiale dans leur réponse aux défis et aux opportunités dans les domaines suivants : Banque et paiements, marchés des capitaux, assurance, gestion de patrimoine et d'actifs et énergie. Découvrez Capco par vous-même sur capco.com.




A propos du poste




Les responsabilités

Travailler avec l'architecte de données et d'autres planificateurs pour évaluer les capacités actuelles et identifier les exigences de haut niveau en matière de données.
Assister l'architecte stratégique, l'architecte métier, l'architecte des données, le responsable des données et le propriétaire des données dans la définition de la stratégie de gestion des données et de l'architecture des données.
Effectuer des analyses de données complexes pour étayer les décisions en matière de gestion des données.

Participer à l'identification et à la proposition de solutions de gestion des données.

Collaborer avec le client, les utilisateurs, l'architecte d'application, l'architecte technique, l'architecte de données, le modélisateur de données, les analystes commerciaux et les concepteurs d'applications pour définir les exigences en matière de qualité et de profilage des données

Obtenir des échantillons de données ou l'accès aux sources de données à profiler.
Configurer et finaliser l'outil de profilage des données pour les activités de profilage des données.
Exécuter les activités de profilage des données.
Examiner les rapports et les résultats du profilage des données afin d'identifier les domaines de préoccupation.
Analyser les problèmes de qualité des données identifiés par rapport au système source et aux capacités existantes en matière de qualité des données afin de confirmer la source du problème de qualité des données.
Examiner les résultats du profilage des données avec les parties prenantes.




Montrez-nous ce que vous avez

Compréhension des processus et des principes relatifs aux données
Capacité à analyser et à concevoir des données et des processus de données
Capacité à développer les exigences du produit sur la base des informations recueillies par l'analyse des données et des solutions de données
Compréhension de l'architecture technologique existante
Connaissance des pratiques commerciales et des processus techniques dont ils sont responsables
Capacité à comprendre les besoins des entreprises
Capacité à évaluer les changements de données en fonction de leur impact sur la technologie
Crédibilité au sein de l'entreprise
Capacité à trouver un équilibre entre les besoins de l'entreprise et les capacités des technologies de l'information
Connaissance des règles de gestion et de données utilisées pour alimenter les données
Excellente vision des processus
Excellentes compétences en matière d'analyse des causes profondes
Communicateur efficace - capable de présenter le contenu et d'obtenir l'adhésion.
Capacité à vérifier l'exhaustivité et la qualité des produits livrables dans le cadre d'un projet, ainsi que le respect des normes établies pour ce dernier.
L'expérience professionnelle est importante. Mais il est primordial que vous partagiez notre conviction que l'innovation perturbatrice permet aux clients de prendre de l'avance sur un marché difficile. Dès le premier jour, votre mission principale sera de percevoir de nouvelles et meilleures façons de faire les choses afin de donner un avantage à vos clients.




Passez à l'étape suivante

Nous avons :

L'accès à des talents spécialisés dans le secteur à l'échelle mondiale
La capacité de tirer parti des meilleurs produits et solutions innovants pour les architectures complexes et les transformations à grande échelle.
Une couverture géographique élargie du marché mondial
La possibilité de capitaliser sur notre empreinte client et notre expertise approfondie dans les domaines des services financiers et de l'énergie.




Pour plus d'informations sur Capco, visitez le site www.Capco.com.

Capco est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l'égalité des chances. Nous évaluons les candidats qualifiés sans tenir compte de la race, de la couleur, de la religion, du sexe, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'identité sexuelle, de l'état civil, des informations génétiques, de l'origine nationale, du handicap, du statut d'ancien combattant et d'autres caractéristiques protégées.




Capco – The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We ware dedicated to fully supporting our world class clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking & Payments, Capital Markets, Insurance, Wealth & Asset Management and Energy . Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com.




About the Role

Responsibilities

Work with the data architect and other planners to assess current capabilities and identify high-level data requirements.
Assist the strategy architect, business architect, data architect, data steward, and data owner in defining the data management strategy and data architecture.
Perform complex data analysis to support data management decisions.
Participate in identifying and proposing data management solutions.
Work with the customer, users, application architect, technical architect, data architect, data modeler, business analysts, and application designers to define the data quality and profiling requirements.
Procure sample data sets or access to data sources to be profiled.
Configure and finalize the data profiling tool for data profiling activities.
Execute data profiling activities.
Review the data profiling reports and outcomes to identify areas of concern.
Analyze identified data quality issues against source system and existing data quality capabilities to confirm the source of the data quality issue.
Review the outcomes of data profiling with stakeholders.




Show Us What You’ve Got

Understanding of data processes and principles
Ability to analyze and design data and data processes
Ability to develop product requirements based on input gathered through analysis of data and data solutions
Understanding of existing technology architecture
Knowledge of the business practices and technical processes for which they are responsible
Ability to understand business requirements
Ability to assess data changes for technology impacts
Credible within the business
Able to balance business needs with IT capabilities
Knowledge of business and data rules used to populate data
Strong process viewpoint
Excellent root cause analysis skills
Effective communicator - able to present content and gain buy-in
Ability to review project deliverables for completeness and quality, and compliance with established project standards
Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From day one, your key mission will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an advantage.







For more information about Capco, visit www.Capco.com.

Capco is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

HTML:
Capco - L'avenir. Aujourd'hui.


Capco est un lieu de travail nettement et positivement différent. Bien plus que des consultants, nous sommes des participants actifs au sein de l'industrie mondiale des services financiers. Nos professionnels passionnés des affaires et de la technologie bénéficient d'un environnement unique où ils sont activement encouragés à mettre en œuvre l'intelligence, l'innovation, l'expérience et le travail d'équipe. Nous nous engageons à soutenir pleinement nos clients de classe mondiale dans leur réponse aux défis et aux opportunités dans les domaines suivants : Banque et paiements, marchés des capitaux, assurance, gestion de patrimoine et d'actifs et énergie. Découvrez Capco par vous-même sur capco.com.


A propos du poste


Les responsabilités

  • Travailler avec l'architecte de données et d'autres planificateurs pour évaluer les capacités actuelles et identifier les exigences de haut niveau en matière de données.
  • Assister l'architecte stratégique, l'architecte métier, l'architecte des données, le responsable des données et le propriétaire des données dans la définition de la stratégie de gestion des données et de l'architecture des données.
  • Effectuer des analyses de données complexes pour étayer les décisions en matière de gestion des données.

Participer à l'identification et à la proposition de solutions de gestion des données.

Collaborer avec le client, les utilisateurs, l'architecte d'application, l'architecte technique, l'architecte de données, le modélisateur de données, les analystes commerciaux et les concepteurs d'applications pour définir les exigences en matière de qualité et de profilage des données

  • Obtenir des échantillons de données ou l'accès aux sources de données à profiler.
  • Configurer et finaliser l'outil de profilage des données pour les activités de profilage des données.
  • Exécuter les activités de profilage des données.
  • Examiner les rapports et les résultats du profilage des données afin d'identifier les domaines de préoccupation.
  • Analyser les problèmes de qualité des données identifiés par rapport au système source et aux capacités existantes en matière de qualité des données afin de confirmer la source du problème de qualité des données.
  • Examiner les résultats du profilage des données avec les parties prenantes.


Montrez-nous ce que vous avez

  • Compréhension des processus et des principes relatifs aux données
  • Capacité à analyser et à concevoir des données et des processus de données
  • Capacité à développer les exigences du produit sur la base des informations recueillies par l'analyse des données et des solutions de données
  • Compréhension de l'architecture technologique existante
  • Connaissance des pratiques commerciales et des processus techniques dont ils sont responsables
  • Capacité à comprendre les besoins des entreprises
  • Capacité à évaluer les changements de données en fonction de leur impact sur la technologie
  • Crédibilité au sein de l'entreprise
  • Capacité à trouver un équilibre entre les besoins de l'entreprise et les capacités des technologies de l'information
  • Connaissance des règles de gestion et de données utilisées pour alimenter les données
  • Excellente vision des processus
  • Excellentes compétences en matière d'analyse des causes profondes
  • Communicateur efficace - capable de présenter le contenu et d'obtenir l'adhésion.
  • Capacité à vérifier l'exhaustivité et la qualité des produits livrables dans le cadre d'un projet, ainsi que le respect des normes établies pour ce dernier.
  • L'expérience professionnelle est importante. Mais il est primordial que vous partagiez notre conviction que l'innovation perturbatrice permet aux clients de prendre de l'avance sur un marché difficile. Dès le premier jour, votre mission principale sera de percevoir de nouvelles et meilleures façons de faire les choses afin de donner un avantage à vos clients.

Title: Data Analyst, ML Datasets
Description:
Are you an experienced data analyst and looking to put your skills towards shaping the future of the latest AI technologies? Join TELUS International AI Data Solutions and help ensure that our Generative AI training datasets statistically reflect the full distribution of human behavior in multi-modal (writing, speech, images, videos, geo-spatial) contexts. We’re hiring experienced data analysts to help bring AI to the next level of performance and accuracy.




Job Description

This is a cross-functional role supporting our pre-sales, operations and product teams with data-driven analyses and insights based on quality and performance data. You’ll craft innovative measurement formulae for GenAI training datasets based on statistical and heuristic data, along multiple dimensions (individual, cohort, task type, language, etc.). You’ll analyze GenAI training dataset metadata to ensure we create GenAI training datasets that optimize diversity, reliability, and relevance.




Responsibilities

Analyze AI training datasets to ensure high quality in terms of reliability, statistical significance and agreement metrics
Statistically review AI training datasets to ensure diverse data representation in terms of client specifications and industry standards
Develop data quality instrumentation specs for deployment in dataset workflows, at individual, regional, task type, and language levels
Design metadata taxonomies to support data analyses of production, workforce and quality metrics
Train project managers in GenAI training dataset data analysis best practices
Prepare GenAI training dataset analysis reports with actionable insights
Support continuous process improvement for operations, workforce sourcing and quality control metrics




Qualifications / Requirements

BA or BSc in Machine Learning, Data Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
3+ years work experience in data analytics, preferably with 1+ years work experience in AI training datasets
Exceptional research and analytical skills
Strong communication skills and reporting skills
Strong organizational skills including prioritizing, time management, and ability to meet tight deadlines




About TELUS International

TELUS International (NYSE: TIXT) focuses on the value of human connection to design, build and deliver high-tech, high-touch customer experiences powered by next-gen digital solutions. With almost 75,000 team members and delivery centers across 30 countries in Africa, Asia, North and Central America, and Europe, TELUS International empowers customer experience innovation through digital enablement, spirited teamwork, agile thinking, and a caring culture that puts customers first. The company's solutions cover customer experience, content moderation, digital transformation, IT lifecycle, advisory and digital consulting, risk management, and back-office support. Fueling any stage of company growth, TELUS International partners with some of the world’s most disruptive brands from fast-growing tech, financial services and fintech, games, travel and hospitality, healthcare, and ICT industries. The company serves clients in over 50 languages. Learn more at: telusinternational.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

We are currently seeking a Data Analyst to join our clients team located in Edmonton, Alberta. The role involves working closely with a cross-functional team in the financial industry, specifically focusing on ETL processes. This Data Analyst contract opportunity is offered with an initial term of 4-months with potential to extend.

Responsibilities


Design, develop, and implement ETL processes to extract data from various sources, including databases, APIs, and flat files
Apply data cleaning, transformation, and enrichment techniques to prepare data for analysis and reporting
Load transformed data into data warehouses, data lakes, or other storage solutions to ensure accessibility and usability
Employ SQL, SSIS, SSRS, SAS and other tools/technologies for data analysis, reporting, performance optimization, and database management
Constantly update knowledge on industry best practices and emerging technologies to provide continuous improvement
Work with a cross-functional team to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Solve complex problems using data-driven techniques
Document all processes, methodologies, and procedures in a clear and concise manner
Handle customer inquiries and provide high quality customer service
Monitor customer accounts and take appropriate action as needed


Requirements


Proven experience with SQL and SAS
Demonstrated understanding and application of Business Logic
Proficient in Database management and Database Object handling
Knowledge in AB Testing
Expertise in Business Intelligence (BI) tools
Ability to create and manage Business Requirement Documents
Strong focus on maintaining Data Quality
Experience in Data Warehousing
Familiarity with ETL - Extract Transform Load processes


Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half works to put you in the best position to succeed. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity - whenever you choose - even on the go.

Questions? Call your local office at 1.888.490.4429. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

Only job postings for jobs located in Quebec appear in French.

Title: BI & Data Analyst - Contract
Description:
Choose a workplace that empowers your impact.

Join a global workplace where employees thrive. One that embraces diversity of thought, expertise and passion. A place where you can personalize your employee journey to be — and deliver — your best.

We are a leading global real estate investor, developer and manager. We combine our capital with our capabilities to create real estate that strengthens economies and communities. By prioritizing people, partnerships and places, we generate meaningful returns for OMERS members, enhance value for our capital partners and create a brighter world for our customers.

Join us to accelerate your growth & development, prioritize wellness, build connections, and support the communities where we live and work.

Don’t just work anywhere — come build tomorrow together with us.

Know someone at OMERS or Oxford Properties? Great! If you're referred, have them submit your name through Workday first. Then, watch for a unique link in your email to apply.

We are looking for a highly motivated BI & Data Analyst to join the Financial Systems Team in Toronto. This role will report to the Senior Manager, Financial Systems and be responsible for acting as a business partner to our finance stakeholders, performing data analysis using a wide variety of applications (including Power BI, Power Platform, UiPath and SQL), and driving automation efforts within the Finance team. To succeed in this role, candidates must be able to drive project completion with strong communication and project management, combined with experience in data analytics, big data mining, and data flow & structure. This role will require effective customer service management, with a proven ability to build relationships between the business groups, financial team and IT department, while being able to multitask in a complex environment.

As a Member Of This Team, You Will


Collaborate with management teams to prioritize business, analytics and information needs and understand project requirements
Work with financial and operational data from primary or secondary data sources from different stakeholder teams and business functions
Seek efficiencies in existing processes and execute process improvement initiatives, including exploring and identifying potential new tools and technologies for enhancing reporting automation capabilities
Identify, analyze, interpret, and report on trends or patterns in complex data sets
Exploring large data sets and drawing meaningful conclusions and insights, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing extracts, reports, printouts, and performance indicators to identify, troubleshoot and resolve problems, including data quality, integrity issues and follow data governance policies
Assist with the preparation and development of reporting, presentations and various materials for discussion at the executive level


To Succeed In This Role, You Have


Undergraduate degree in Accounting, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field.
Have a minimum of 1-2 years of demonstrated experience in a similar role (e.g. Data Analyst or BI Data Analyst).
Team oriented individual with strong communication skills, who is comfortable engaging with different groups within the organization (including non-technical audiences).
Strong project management and organizational skills and ability to work under pressure and manage high priority projects with multiple or competing deadlines.
Willingness to learn new technologies, including RPA, with a strong inclination to improve processes and not settle for ‘status quo’ to generate efficiencies and improve capabilities.
Experience with UiPath Studio, Power Platform, Power BI, SQL, and advanced Excel functionality (including Power Query, VBA) to develop automation solutions. Experience with other BI Tools an asset.
Technical expertise in data mining and analysis, with an understanding of financial reporting concepts.
Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills and innovative approaches for resolution.


Oxford's purpose is to strengthen economies and communities through real estate.

Our people-first culture is at its best when our workforce reflects the communities we live and work — and the customers we proudly serve.

From hire to retire, we are an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process that extends all the way through your employee experience. This sense of belonging and connection is cultivated up, down and across our global organization thanks to our vast network of Employee Resource Groups with executive leader sponsorship, our Purpose@Work committee and employee recognition programs.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
The individual will work in the FRMT(Financial Resource Management Technology) Data Services team within Citi’s Global Functions Technology . The Data Services team is responsible for Data Steward activities that involve liaising with Data owners, Business Treasury and Chief Data Office teams providing business support and ensure proper governance of Citi Data Governance Policy & Standards.

This group is a critical contributor in strategic projects supporting regulatory feedback and influence Citi’s data infrastructure. To this end, we are seeking a Financial Services analyst (preferably with experience from a major US Bank) with 5 - 8 years of experience in regulatory reporting or liquidity management cross-functional programs.

This is an individual contributor , position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. In this role you will have the opportunity to work on solutions to challenging data problems that involve executing on critical aspects of data governance policy. You will also leverage and further develop your leadership skills, as well as build relationships with others throughout the organization. Please see below for further details. If you think this position may be right for you, we encourage you to apply! Our people make all the difference in our success.

Main responsibilities


Participate in the data requirements and issues management process for liquidity regulatory reporting including FR2052a
Participate in the design of Citi’s detective and preventative controls around liquidity data to support data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness
Support committee discussions and working groups that would review and approve liquidity issue remediation and prioritization
Help implement recommendations against liquidity data quality issues that may influence balance sheet and liquidity optimization across legal entities and businesses
Help drive execution of critical aspects of data governance policy and data strategy.
You will partner with data consumers to agree on the scope of critical data quality challenges and ensure that the data operating model is implemented to reduce data risk.
Remediation of issues will include partnering with various business and technology functions. You will help build a deep, comprehensive, and documented understanding of Citi’s key data, data processes, and data flows. Partnering with business data owners will be required to ensure maintenance of key artifacts and overall data quality improvements.
You will be hands-on leading the consolidation of disparate information about the data, as well as ensuring a sustainable understanding of how data flows through operational and analytic platforms and assist Data owner in institutionalizing an enhanced understanding of information assets at an aggregate level, data concept level, and data attribute level.
You will lead initiatives in order to reduce Citi’s data management risks, as well as support the cultural shift toward active data management and ownership.
Identify data quality “hot spots” or points of exposure. Determine strategies to improve data quality controls and monitoring routines to de-risk points of data quality vulnerabilities using CDO approved tools and solutions.
Create or support the creation of data and system flow documentation and process maps. Work to align other key data capabilities including metadata repositories, data dictionaries, data lineage, business process maps, and training materials with the data and system process flows.
Be a trusted and informed advisor/partner to regional teams and lines of business staff members.
Prepare and present status updates and solutions to stakeholders, business partners, and technology teams in a succinct manner to drive decisions and actions.
Lead meetings and working sessions to solve issues, challenges, and risks by factoring input from partners and diverse points of view.
Promote “data as an asset” and influence culture change to make the organization increasingly more data-driven.
Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and provides user and operational support
Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Act as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts and work as a team to achieve business objectives, performing other duties and functions as assigned
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques to identify trends or patterns in complex data sets
Understanding current data processes and business requirements to help determine new and innovative ways to provide end-to-end solutions .
Qualifications:
2 - 8 years of regulatory reporting, data management or liquidity management experience, preferably in Data Management, Legal, Controllers, Treasury or a Business with an understanding of liquidity-based data, regulatory reporting, analytics, and applicable regulations such as US LCR, US NSFR, and FR 2052a reporting
At least 5+ years of experience in banking and financial services industry, Capital Markets , information technology, and data governance.
5-8 years of relevant experience in business analysis or systems analysis.
3+ years of Data Analysis/ Data Investigation
2+ years of SQL
Proficiency in presentation tools is required
Ability to communicate (both verbal and written) issues in a clear and timely manner to build trusting partnership a wide variety of audiences and stakeholders.
Self-motivated, highly-focused, detail-oriented as well as a team player with high energy levels and the desire to learn and progress within the company.
Knowledge of business analysis procedures and concepts and basic knowledge of other technical areas
Proven analytical, interpersonal and organizational skills
Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication
Proven ability to effectively use complex analytical, interpretive and problem-solving techniques
Proven relationship management skills to partner and influence across organizational lines
Demonstrated ability to work on multiple projects in the stream simultaneously
Comfortable working with large data volumes and be able to demonstrate a firm understanding of logical data structures and analysis techniques


Education:


Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience. MBA or CFA Level 1 preferred

------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------

Full time

Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

The individual will work in the FRMT(Financial Resource Management Technology) Data Services team within Citi’s Global Functions Technology . The Data Services team is responsible for Data Steward activities that involve liaising with Data owners, Business Treasury and Chief Data Office teams providing business support and ensure proper governance of Citi Data Governance Policy & Standards.

This group is a critical contributor in strategic projects supporting regulatory feedback and influence Citi’s data infrastructure. To this end, we are seeking a Financial Services analyst (preferably with experience from a major US Bank) with 5 - 8 years of experience in regulatory reporting or liquidity management cross-functional programs.

This is an individual contributor , position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. In this role you will have the opportunity to work on solutions to challenging data problems that involve executing on critical aspects of data governance policy. You will also leverage and further develop your leadership skills, as well as build relationships with others throughout the organization. Please see below for further details. If you think this position may be right for you, we encourage you to apply! Our people make all the difference in our success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Description

Are you ready to join an outstanding culture that cares about diversity and inclusion, corporate social responsibility and gives the freedom to innovate, influence decisions, and chart an exciting career?

CGI is more than just an IT consulting company; be part of a team that supports the local community with the ability draw on global best-in-class talent. CGI is looking for a Data Analyst for its expanding team to assist our clients with their data and analytics journey. Benefits include a share purchase program, profit sharing, wellness credits, training and development programs, and flexible work schedules and locations.

The responsibilities and requirements that follow provide insight into what a Member at CGI will typically experience in this role and the characteristics they have that lead to success. We are looking for candidates that have a similar mix of experience and qualifications. These are individuals who have a passion to create value for clients by helping them unlock the value in their data assets.

Your future duties and responsibilities


Solve challenging and impactful problems using your data expertise, and ability to communicate compelling insight through data visualizations, reports, and dashboards
Help create the platform, tools, and APIs necessary to enable other teams to work with data
Efficiently handle vast amounts of data from multiple sources and destinations, including relational and NoSQL databases as well as external systems, both in batch processing and real-time delivery
Work on high priority initiatives using advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and data from a variety of data sources to produce actionable business insights
Provide guidance to a customer and project team with respect to technical feasibility, complexity, and level of effort required to deliver a solution
Work closely with other team members to further develop metrics, KPIs, and insights that measure business performance improvements
Assist in the development and delivery of pre and post sales POCs (proof of concept), presentations and proposals for client engagements
Analytical curiosity, strong data-oriented skills, and a statistical programming background


Education:


Bachelor's degree in mathematics, business, statistics, economics, computer science or information systems (or equivalent combination of skill and experience)


Build your career with us:

As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role


Experience doing data analysis, reporting and advanced analytical modeling
Hands on experience in deploying reporting and analytical solutions to on premise and cloud-based infrastructure
Hands-on experience writing complex SQL queries and working with relational databases such as Oracle, DB2, SQL Server, etc.
Hands-on experience with data reporting and visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, Qlik…etc.
Experience with modern software development techniques and methodologies: DevSecOps, Agile, etc.
Knowledge and practice of secure software development processes


Attributes:


Up to date with the latest technology trends and have a strong desire to constantly learn
Highly detailed-oriented with exceptional organizational and follow-through skills
Self-starter and able to execute without a lot of direction or oversight - demonstrable problem-solving skills
Value teamwork and urgency, with a passion for driving impact
Ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines
Exceptional communication skills, with an ability to make technical concepts accessible and understandable to non-technical business users


Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a fast-growing producer of spirit-based beverages is seeking a data analyst. This candidate will work with the executive team, regional management and sales representatives across Canada preparing detailed analysis of sales, inventory data and other reports as required.

The primary focus of this position is collecting, inputting, and analyzing large volumes of data from various provincial sources, finalizing and distributing reports. This position requires expert level excel skills, data management skills and basic accounting knowledge.

Analysts with previous consumer packaged goods experience or alcohol industry experience are especially sought after for this role.

Responsibilities

Input/Analyze data from multiple sources to complete standardized weekly and monthly sales reports.
Utilize territory sales data and geographic mapping to identify opportunities for sales growth.
Ensure checks and balances across all weekly, bi-weekly and monthly reports for sales data and accounting purposes.
Support business decisions with ad hoc analysis as needed.

Qualifications & Skill set

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, or Mathematics.
5 years experience in an analytics role, prior experience in the alcohol industry is preferred.
Expert level skill in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and Access.
Experience analyzing large amounts of confidential data.
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and meet tight deadlines.
Critical thinker with excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong verbal and written communication.

Compensation/Benefits

Attractive compensation package.
Comprehensive benefit package.
Bonus opportunity.
3 weeks vacation.

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Analytics (18-month Contract)
Description:
OPPORTUNITY

Fengate is seeking a highly skilled Senior Analyst, Data Analytics to join our team at Fengate Asset Management. As a leading Asset Management firm with over $7 billion in asset under management, Fengate specializes in Infrastructure, Real Estate, and Private Equity investments and is committed to delivering exceptional value to our clients. 

The ideal candidate will have a strong background as a Data Engineer or as a Data Analyst in a financial environment, preferably with experience in asset management and/or private equity.

The primary responsibility of this role is to maintain and optimize our analytical solution, ensuring accurate and efficient data analysis, reporting, and visualization using Power BI, SQL, Excel Power Query/VBA, and Microsoft Azure services. In addition, the role involves collaborating closely with all business units, ensuring alignment on data initiatives, managing stakeholder expectations, and supporting business needs. The candidate should possess strong financial knowledge and in-depth experience in analyzing financial data.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Data Solution Development and Maintenance

Maintain and enhance the existing analytical solution, ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and optimal performance.
Develop and implement data models, transformations, visualizations, and customized dashboards using Power BI to meet business requirements.
Utilize Excel Power Query and VBA to streamline data processing tasks and automate workflows.
Develop and implement best practices for data upload and ensure accuracy in data outputs.
Design and optimize SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from various data sources and Azure SQL.

Stakeholder Management and Collaboration

Gather, review, and analyze business requirements from various business units.
Maintain and manage the backlog of requirements, conducting prioritization calls with business stakeholders to manage expectations.
Manage project timelines for deliverables.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and understand business needs and translate them into actionable analytics solutions.
Provide technical guidance and support to stakeholders, including training on analytical solution usage and troubleshooting.
Collaborate and liaise between various business units to ensure alignment and timely communication on data-related projects.

Continuous Improvement and Innovation

Proactively identify areas of enhancement with a mindset of continuous improvement.
Stay up to date with the latest industry trends, best practices, and advancements in analytical tools and technologies.

Data Pipeline Management

Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, ensuring smooth data flow and resolving issues or bottlenecks.
Work with Microsoft Azure services, such as Data Factory, to orchestrate data movement and processing workflows.
Develop and maintain Azure logic apps workflows.

Documentation and Governance

Maintain documentation related to the analytical solution, including data models, data dictionaries, and technical specifications.
Ensure compliance with data management, governance, and security best practices.



Requirements



KEY QUALIFICATIONS

Excellent communication and collaboration skills to effectively work with cross-functional teams.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Finance or a related field.
Proven experience in maintaining and optimizing analytical solutions.
Strong proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling, DAX calculations, and report/dashboard design.
Solid knowledge of SQL for data manipulation, querying, and performance optimization.
Proficiency in Excel Power Query and VBA for data processing and automation.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure services, particularly Data Factory, for data integration and orchestration.
Excellent understanding of financial concepts, terminology, and experience working with financial data and ability to implement best practices around data management, compliance and governance.
Previous experience in a Data Engineer or Data Analyst role in a financial environment, preferably in asset management or private equity, is highly desirable.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

CORE COMPETENCIES

Being Authentic -Inspiring trust and being courageous.
Focusing on Performance -Being accountable and driving results.
Understanding Stakeholders - Knowing the needs of those who rely on you.
Building Effective Relationships - Collaboration and communication.

Fengate is an equal opportunity employer, we strive to attract and retain a diverse workforce and are committed to promoting diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace. It is a core priority at Fengate to create, operate with, and continuously grow and sustain an inclusive culture that respects and connects the diversity of our team, our clients, our partners, and the communities we work in. 

We are committed to providing accommodation for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest in this position; however only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your Knowledge of Power BI and Data Analysis

To our Information Technology Team




CPA Ontario is currently in search of a Data Analyst who will be responsible for extracting, analyzing, and interpreting financial data from various sources to support strategic decision-making and operational initiatives. As part of our Enterprise Architecture team, you will work closely with other cross-functional departments including IT, Finance and Operations, collaborating with business stakeholders to provide actionable insights and recommendations. As a Data Analyst you will be accountable for understanding data needs, working to design and develop reports and dashboards, and conducting thorough data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Working collaboratively with business stakeholders within IT, Business Intelligence and Finance departments and other operational teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.




Extracting, cleaning, and manipulating large datasets from multiple sources including financial databases, CRM systems, ERP systems, and spreadsheets.




Performing analysis of data to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.




Designing and developing reports, dashboards, and data visualizations to present findings in a clear and concise manner.




Preparing regular and ad-hoc reports and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders.




Conducting variance analysis and performance reporting to support budgeting and forecasting processes.




Assisting in the design and implementation of data collection systems and strategies to optimize efficiency and data quality.




Administering, monitoring, supporting and maintaining SQL servers in our environment.




Staying current in industry trends and best practices in data analysis and modeling.




Who You Are:

A post-secondary graduate preferably in information systems, information technology, computer science, or related field.




Experienced in working with databases and ERP systems with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in a Data Analyst role.




Proficient in SQL, Microsoft Excel and data processing tools and software – in particular Power BI.




Proficient in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and SharePoint. Experience with Salesforce or other CRM considered an asset.




Highly organized and able to manage projects and timelines within tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.




Able to work efficiently and effectively as a team member, as well as independently.




An excellent communicator with the ability to convey ideas succinctly and conveying complex findings and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders with ease.




A self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think analytically about solutions.




Committed to ongoing training and a desire to learn new skills and continually expand upon knowledge and expertise.




What We Offer:

A fast-paced environment. Collaboration, innovation and passionate professionals are at our core. We relentlessly pursue what’s next to unlock the full potential of you and us together.




Flexible work environments. As part of our Hybrid work culture, we provide flexible, remote work options to support you in your career, in addition to in-office teamwork and collaboration.




Diversity and inclusion. We recognize the value in our differences and prioritize inclusivity to bring together the best talent to protect the public, advance the profession and enable CPAs to lead business and society forward.




Ongoing learning and career growth. We want your career to skyrocket. We support career advancement and professional development opportunities with learning investments to promote your future growth. Thrive with us.




Focus on your well-being. With industry leading benefits and wellness programs, including a healthy lifestyle allowance, mental health resources and more, we’re committed to your well-being.




Who We Are:

We protect the public. We advance the profession. We enable CPAs to lead business and society forward. We ensure that our 103,000 members and 18,000 students meet the highest standards of integrity and expertise. We help them stay ahead of global market trends and abreast of regulatory change. CPAs represent a globally recognized, premium designation. Our Chartered Professional Accountants are valued by organizations in all industries for their financial expertise, strategic thinking, management skills and leadership. We believe that success happens when both business and society benefit. For information on the profession visit: cpaontario.ca.




We Appreciate Your Interest In CPA Ontario And This Position:

At CPA Ontario, we are committed to building high-performance teams. Our selection process is thorough, and all candidate applications are reviewed. Should your qualifications and experience meet the requirements of this role, a member of our recruitment team will contact you. We encourage you to set up CPA Ontario job alerts for positions that align to your experience and career goals.




CPA Ontario is an inclusive employer. Accommodation is available under the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please email accessibility@cpaontario.ca with “Accommodation Required” in the subject line to provide your contact information. A member of the Recruitment team will contact you within 48 hours.

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2013, Organigram first began as a medical cannabis provider. Today, the Company is focused on winning in the Canadian recreational market and dynamically expanding the company’s global footprint and influence.

Organigram has developed a portfolio of adult-use recreational cannabis brands including Edison, Big Bag o’ Buds, SHRED, Monjour, Holy Mountain and Trailblazer. Quebec’s top-selling hash brand Tremblant Cannabis, and artisanal craft brand, Laurentian are also additions to Organigram’s brand portfolio. Organigram operates facilities in three provinces across the country. The primary indoor growing facility is in Moncton, New Brunswick, the premium hash production and premium cultivation facility is in Lac-Supérieur, Quebec and there is a highly automated facility dedicated to edibles manufacturing in Winnipeg, Manitoba. The Company is regulated by Health Canada under the Cannabis Act (Canada) and the Cannabis Regulations (Canada).

Organigram is focused on translating operational excellence into strong financial results and return on investment for shareholders.

Job Summary

As a Commercial Analyst based in Toronto, Ontario, you will be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making processes. You’ll collaborate closely with the Commercial and IT teams to extract, transform, and analyze data, providing actionable insights that optimize our recreational cannabis commercial strategies. Your work will directly inform sales, marketing, finance, and supply chain decisions, helping to drive growth and efficiency across the company.

This role is perfect for someone who enjoys working with data, is eager to develop their skills in a dynamic environment and is excited about making a tangible impact on one of Canada’s leading licensed producer.

Key Responsibilities

Analyze commercial performance data to support decision-making across sales, marketing, commercialization and supply chain teams.
Develop and enhance Power BI dashboards and other analytical tools, transforming data into clear, actionable insights.
Extract, clean, maintain, and transform data from multiple internal and external sources for analysis.
Create and maintain data models to ensure accurate reporting and forecasting.
Translate business questions into analytical projects and deliver data-driven recommendations.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to support strategic initiatives and solve specific business challenges.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity in all analysis and reporting.
Continuously seek opportunities to improve data analytics processes and tools in collaboration with IT and business teams.

Key Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within consumer packaged goods (CPG) / fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), or a similar industry.
Strong Power BI skills: Experience with DAX, Power Query, and building dashboards and data visualizations is essential.
Proficiency in MS Excel, including advanced functionalities such as pivot tables, complex formulas, and data analysis tools.
Proficiency in SQL, with experience in writing and optimizing queries.
Exposure to Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, data modelling, data warehousing and data management.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and make actionable recommendations.
Effective communication skills, able to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in the cannabis industry is a strong plus but not required.
Basic knowledge of Python for scripting or automating tasks (preferred).Basic knowledge of Azure Data Factory and data ingestion architecture within an Azure Cloud environment (preferred).
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, work in a collaborative environment and meet tight deadlines.

Why Join Us?

Growth Opportunity:This role offers the chance to deepen your expertise in analytics and gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced industry.
Impact:Your work will directly influence commercial strategies and contribute to the company's success.
Collaborative Environment:Work closely with a passionate team that values innovation, creativity, and continuous improvement.

Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
Who We Are

tsworks Canada, Inc is a technology products and services company based out of Ontario, Canada. We are a subsidiary of The Software Works, Inc, USA. Our mission is to adopt, challenge and set the best practices in Information Technology. At tsworks Canada Inc, we value our employees, take pride in providing best value in customer engagements, and make every effort to be transparent, responsible, and prompt in our commitments.




About This Role

tsworks Canada, Inc is seeking driven and motivated Lead Data Analyst to join its Digital Services Team. You will get hands-on experience with projects employing industry-leading technologies. This position will be a contract to perm, reporting to the Senior Manager and work type will be hybrid with a 2-3 days per week, on-site, in our clients’ locations in Vancouver, BC. This would initially be focused on the operational readiness and maintenance of existing applications and would transition into a build and maintenance role in the long run.




Position: Lead Data Analyst 
Experience: - 10+ Years of hands-on experience in Information Technology 

- 5+ years of experience designing and executing data solutions in Business Intelligence. 

Location: Vancouver, BC 




What skills do we expect from you on Power BI 

Extensive hands-on Power BI visual dashboards, applications, KPI (key performance indicators) scorecards, DAX functions. 
Experience with performance tuning Power BI datasets and reports with Direct and Import mode, Aggregations, Filter Contexts, Partitioning, Row Level Security etc. 
Experience managing and optimizing Power BI Capacities, using Advanced Restful APIs 




What skills do we expect from you in Data and Analytics 

Experience on cloud data ecosystems AWS (Amazon Web Services) Redshift, Azure Synapse, Snowflake or Data Bricks 
Experience writing and tuning performance on complex SQL queries. 
Experience with Star/Snowflake data models 
Experience providing solutions on Retail or Finance data domains. 
Ability to articulate, create, and maintain technical and non-technical documentation. 




In This Role, You Will  

Design and build data applications on public cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and/or hybrid cloud using a well architected framework. 
Leveraging expertise in data analysis, visualization, and business intelligence to provide valuable insights and support data-driven decision-making within the organization. 
Lead a team of data analysts to execute the data strategy and maintain the ecosystem. 
Regular evaluation of changes in the data industry and adopt the best practices in terms of technology, governance, security, and compliance. 
Optimize cloud data infrastructure costs. 
Respond to technical issues in a professional and timely manner. 
Develop Power BI visual dashboards, KPI scorecards, and reports utilizing Microsoft technology stack. 
Leverage modern Power BI to extract and manipulate data from a variety of diverse sources. 
Write complex DAX functions in Power BI and Power Pivot. 
Present alternative ways for internal customers to visualize and consume data. 
Understand business questions/pain points and alleviate with supporting data. 
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and adherence to data governance policies. Conduct data quality checks and implement measures to maintain data integrity. 
Research advanced analytic/visualization capabilities to improve customer understanding of data insights. 
Collaborate cross-functionally at various levels and diplomatically influence stakeholders. 
Demonstrate excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. 
Demonstrate the ability to multi-task, deal effectively with ambiguity, change in business requirements, and self-prioritize under pressure. 
Debug data issues and deliver quality results under tight timelines. 

 

Preferences 

Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, information technology, or relevant field. 
Experience in Azure Data Factory or other ETL (Extraction, Transformation, Loading) tools solutioning and development 
Experience working in an agile setting. 
Being self-driven, naturally curious, and able to adapt to a fast-paced work environment. 
Public cloud certifications. 
Excellent Communication Skills

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Company Profile:

Join one of the fastest growing companies in Canada! LawDepot is proud to be a seven-time Growth 500 ranked organization and a major player in the Global legal solutions industry. Our mission is to modernize the legal document creation experience by empowering people with fast, easy-to-use, and professional solutions. With over ten million satisfied customers worldwide, over two million monthly website visitors, and billions of dollars saved on legal fees, you will be joining a team that is truly making a difference. At LawDepot, we foster a collaborative and inclusive learning culture that values excellence and diversity. Apply today and become a part of our exciting journey!




Position Overview:

LawDepot.com is currently expanding and looking to recruit a Business Data Analyst in Edmonton, Alberta. Working with the Revenue Operations team, this position will be responsible for performing in-depth analysis of the user behavior on our Checkout pages. This is a full-time permanent position, working 37.5 hours per week with opportunities for a hybrid work schedule.




Primary Responsibilities:

Conduct usage analysis on experiment and non-experiment data to understand customer behavior on the Checkout page
Analyze and understand why customers take certain actions
Develop plans to track Checkout page usage and to improve event reporting
Improve and maintain automated reports
Communicate data analysis results and recommendations
Create new projects based on experiment results
Collaborate with analysts, software developers, and key stakeholders
Deliver data-based recommendations and identify next steps
Discover data trends and findings across different projects & experiments
Review and consult on experiment design and implementation
Build attribution models for website event tracking
Create reports and data visualizations to increase the quality of analysis being delivered
Collaboratively identify relevant KPIs for individual projects, and engagement metrics (usage, renewals, etc.) and how they should be measured
Help Senior Data Analysts with planning future phases for various projects
Create quarterly/annual reports and presentations




Knowledge and Skill Requirements:

Post-secondary education in Business, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other Analysis related programs
In-depth understanding of relational database structure and principles
Experience with statistical analysis
High level of proficiency with SQL coding, creating reports, and running queries
Knowledge in data analysis and visualizations tools (like Python, R, D3.js, Matplotlib, etc.)
Proficiency using Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, Visualizations, Formulas) and Project Management software
Experience conducting financial analysis on large datasets
Knowledge of data mining and segmentation techniques
Ability to work independently and manage complex projects
Ability to summarize complicated analysis and make it easy to understand
Strong interest in data analysis and developing creative solutions to problems




Why You Should Join the LawDepot Team:

Excellent total compensation package
Comprehensive health and dental benefits, plus an additional Health Care Spending Account
Great work life balance (37.5 hour work weeks, flexible schedules, ability to bank hours)
Three weeks paid vacation, plus bonus personal days
Continuous learning opportunities, including LinkedIn Learning subscriptions and training budgets
Company share plan
Free catered lunches for the entire office
Monthly social events for team members to enjoy (think axe throwing, rock climbing, board games, food trucks, trivia contests, and charitable activities)
Casual work environment
Personal offices for focused work and to have your individual space (plus collaborative workspaces for when you want to meet with the team)
Free and easily accessible parking
Southgate Mall, Whyte Ave, and Calgary Trail restaurants are only minutes away
Hybrid working arrangements for that balance between getting work done at home and engaging with others in the office




How to Apply:

Please submit a resume and cover letter by email to career@lawdepot.ca or submit online via our Careers page at https://www.lawdepot.com/career




We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst - co-op - Winter 2025
Description:
Change the future with us.

We are passionate about innovations that mean real progress. We are excited about technologies that still need to be developed. What about you? Do you want to use your curiosity, passion, and creativity to make the lives of millions of people easier and better? Join us as a graduate –either by beginning your career with us or through a co-op placement. Whichever path you take, we’re looking forward to seeing your perspective.

Why you’ll love working for Siemens!


Freedom and a healthy work- life balance– Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.
Solve the world’s most significant problems – Be part of exciting and innovative projects.
Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.
Opportunities to advance your career and mentorship programs on a local and global scale.
Competitive total rewards package
Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education, access to technology and sustaining communities and make a positive impact on the community.
Participate in our celebrations, social events and offsite business events.
Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
Employee perks and discounts.
Diversity and inclusivity focused.


Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers 2023, Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2024 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.

What will you do?

Siemens RuggedCom is a leader in the development of rugged communication networking solutions designed for mission critical applications in harsh environments. We are an innovative, rapidly growing company where you'll find an exciting, dynamic work environment and significant opportunity for personal growth.

We are looking for a Data Analyst for our Concord office who would report directly to the Head of Lean & Business Excellence for the Winter Term (Jan - April, 2025); someone with good analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills.

Responsibilities:

This role provides an opportunity to gain experience in data analytics and automation. The responsibilities include developing data processing workflows, automation, visualization, and dashboards. You will be

Must be a student pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematic with a focus on data analytics

What will you need to succeed?


Candidates must be either third-year undergraduate students or graduate students pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics with a focus on data analytics.
Having completed at least one co-op term is a strong asset
The ideal candidate will be familiar with or have experience in some or all the following areas:
Python
SQL
Snowflake / dbt
Power BI
Tableau
Interface design concepts such as user experience, information architecture, data modelling, visual design, etc.
Strong communication and written skills
Strong knowledge of MS Excel
Must be available for a 4-month contract starting Jan 2025
Must be available to work on-site at the Concord office an average of 2 days per week.

About Us.

We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.

Siemens Canada is a technology company focused on industry, infrastructure, transport, and healthcare. From more resource-efficient factories, resilient supply chains, and smarter buildings and grids, to cleaner and more comfortable transportation as well as advanced healthcare, the company creates technology with purpose, adding real value for customers since 1912. By combining the real and the digital worlds, Siemens empowers its customers to transform their industries and markets, to transform the everyday for billions of people. Siemens also owns a majority stake in the publicly listed company Siemens Healthineers, a globally leading medical technology provider shaping the future of healthcare. In addition, Siemens holds a minority stake in Siemens Energy, a global leader in the transmission and generation of electrical power. As of September 30, 2023, the company has approximately 4,200 employees from coast-to-coast and 33 office and production facilities across Canada. Siemens Canada has a revenue of ~ CAD $2Billion.

Siemens is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Siemens Canada will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

By submitting personal information to Siemens Canada Limited or its affiliates, service providers and agents, you consent to our collection, use and disclosure of such information for the purposes described in our Privacy Notice available at www.siemens.ca.

Siemens s’engage à créer un environnement diversifié et est fière d’être un employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Sur demande, Siemens Canada prendra des mesures d’accommodement raisonnables pour les personnes handicapées, dans le but de soutenir la participation des candidats dans tous les aspects du processus de recrutement. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour ce poste.

En transmettant des renseignements personnels à Siemens Canada limitée ou à ses sociétés affiliées, à ses fournisseurs de services ou à ses agents, vous nous autorisez à recueillir, à utiliser et à divulguer ces renseignements aux fins prévues dans notre Déclaration de protection de la confidentialité, que vous pouvez consulter au www.siemens.ca.
